thread.title: The Third Cheapest City In The World Happens To Be The Silicon Valley Of India
thread.title_full: The Third Cheapest City In The World Happens To Be The Silicon Valley Of India

title: The Third Cheapest City In The World Happens To Be The Silicon Valley Of India
text:
The Third Cheapest City In The World Happens To Be The Silicon Valley Of India Who'll Are Heading To Bengaluru Already? Print   Quick Take: 
The Economist Intelligence Unit's (EIU) Worldwide Cost of Living 2017 report--a ranking of the world’s major cities--claims that Asia is home to some of the world’s most expensive cities and also to many of the world’s cheapest. 
The Worldwide Cost of Living, an international survey, has found out that the Silicon Valley of India, Bengaluru, is the third cheapest city in the world. 
A couple of other Indian cities follow closely; Chennai being the 6th, Mumbai being the 7th (we wonder how, considering real estate costs don't seem to go down EVER here!), while New Delhi being the 10th. 
“Although the Indian subcontinent remains structurally cheap, instability is becoming an increasingly prominent factor in lowering the relative cost of living of a location,” the EIU report stated, adding that “this means that there is a considerable element of risk in some of the world's cheapest cities”. 
The survey was based on the cost of 160 products and services, which included food, drink, clothing, household supplies and personal care items, home rents, transport, utility bills, private schools, domestic help and recreational costs. 
Almaty in Kazakhstan has been ranked the cheapest in the world, while Singapore retained its title as the world's most expensive city for the fourth consecutive year. 
Are you packing your bags already, Mumbai and Dilli-wallahs ?
